title: Prerendering
description: Nuxt allows pages to be statically rendered at build time to improve certain performance or SEO metrics

children.value: Nuxt allows for select pages from your application to be rendered at build time. Nuxt will serve the prebuilt pages when requested instead of generating them on the fly.
to build and pre-render your application using the
crawler. This command is similar to
This will build your site, stand up a nuxt instance, and, by default, prerender the root page
along with any of your site's pages it links to, any of your site's pages they link to, and so on.

Repeat steps 1-3 for each anchor tag found until there are no more anchor tags to crawl.
This is important to understand since pages that are not linked to a discoverable page can't be pre-rendered automatically.
You can manually specify routes that
will fetch and pre-render during the build or ignore routes that you don't want to pre-render like

children.value: Read more about pre-rendering in the Nitro documentation.
Lastly, you can manually configure this using routeRules.

props.className: language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight twoslash lsp

children.value: Global route options applied to matching server routes.
This is an experimental feature and API may change in the future.
// Set prerender to true to configure it to be prerendered
// Set it to false to configure it to be skipped for prerendering
// Everything under /blog gets prerendered as long as it
// is linked to from another page

children.value: This is called for each route during prerendering. You can use this for fine grained handling of each route that gets prerendered.
